reviewText:
Now, I'm giving the show 5 stars because it's totally brilliant.  But if I could give it 4.5 I would, because to tell you the truth, the ending of this season isn't as good as the season one's, in fact, this one is a cliffhander for season 3 (which is confirmed to air in october).
However, it's so intense, and unbelievably remarkable, that when it's over, you go "whew!" because all you care about is that Jack is ok...
or not...
[...]

I was always skeptical about 24 going into a second season. It ended near perfectly at the end of the first season. Buy when I checked out season two, I was hooked all over again. Not only is the season more interesting, it involves issues that our world is currently dealing with. Not only that, but the action has been pumped up 400%, that acting keeps getting better, and Jack (Keifer Sutherland) is one of the best characters to follow on TV.
With the finale just around the corner, and a new third season on the way, I think it is safe to say this DVD is a perfect buy for any fan of the show, or anybody who missed its initial run and wants to see what all the hype is about. Surely it will have many more special features than season 1 did, since the first season DVD was produced and created in about 2 months. Most likely as well as the stuff season one's had, like preview for season three, and quite possibly an alernate ending. Hopefully they will put in some commentaries in the mix as well.
But anyway.....
Fox is doing a great job with their TV on DVD lately. They started off slow, but with sales growing and growing, they are picking up the pace, and seem to be producing better quality DVD's.
Now I just need to wait for the rest of Angel, The Shield, Farscape, The Dead Zone, and The Simpsons to be released.....

24 Season 2, is the graetest thing to ever happen to me. I have a new hero and his name is Jack. Every moment that i spend with the cast of 24, I learn a new move that will help me become a top secret agent. 24 season two on dvd showed me that if i need to it's ok to saw off a terrorists head in order to get some info. I din't know that before. the quality of the dvd's is outstanding. the cast tremendous. (I also like pm for kids) David Palmer has really streched his acting limits. He's come along way from major league. I also enjoyed him in heat. great friggen flick. Has any of the cast thought about starring in back to the future 4? I'll write the script if you need it. One question. Do you guys ever get tired being up all day? I know that i would. I bet you drink lots of coffee. Helps keep you sharp eh! Well thanks jack. I've learned alot. and lets go get some bad guys!

24 has to be one of the best shows on TV.  If you are looking for suspense, action, deep plot twists, intense characters, and much more, this is for you.  I can't wait for season two to join my collection.  Season one was intense in its character development and its twisting and turning storyline.  Season two adds action and new characters to the mix, and still manages to throw a few curve balls that you'll never see coming.

The people who wrote 24 had this storyline planned out before Sept 11 i believe, and the show was not intended to mirror real life at all.  I highly recommend watching Season One first, in fact I think it should be required because many Season Two plot twists refer to things that happen in Season One.  I think it's a great show, and definitely one of the best on TV right now and personally it's the best TV show i've ever watched.

Some Americans are really taking this 'war on terrorism' malarky way too far. C'mon, it's even infiltrating your television series' now. Viewers in the rest of the world are, via series' like this, force fed this kind of paranoid android stuff every DAY. Enough. The first series was fine, the subtext in this one puts me off completely, an endless and futile 'art reflecting life' cycle. Production values, good scripting, good character arcs, excellent work in front of and behind the cameras and dramatic tension are its plus points.

I can't wait for this thrill ride to continue.  Glad they picked up season 3, another dvd set to add to my collection.  Definately the best show on tv, unlike anything out there.  Can't wait for season 2 dvd.  I hope it will have extra features, maybe even some easter eggs.

As this season opens, Jack Bauer's (Kiefer Sutherland) life is falling apart.  His wife was murdered, and his daughter, Kim has disowned him.  Suddenly he gets a call from the President of the United States (expertly portrayed by Dennis Haysbert) asking him to stop a terrorist plot to detonate a nuclear weapon in Los Angeles.
  Upon accepting the mission, Jack is thrust into an emotional game of mystery and deciet as he goes undercover to uncover the location of the bomb.  One of the highlights of the season is when Jack is reunited with Nina Myers (Sara Clarke), Jack's former co-worker at the Counter-Terrorist Unit, who is responsible for murdering his wife.
  The real-time aspect of the show helps to build the tension as things get steadily worse for Jack Bauer.  Attention is given to every minor detail in order to maintain consistancy throughout the story.
  The characters constantly change throughout the story as the situations gets more intense.  George Mason, Jack's untrusting boss, learns to respect Jack's unconventional methods and in the end is willing to sacrifice himself so that Jack can have a second chance to put his life back together.  Tony, Jack's friend, will eventually try to hinder Jack's investigation, which has the potential to prevent an all-out war!
  Based on the features of the previous DVD, we can expect the season to be presented in the Widescreen format, with surround sound, and a preview of what is to come in Season three.  I know I speak for every fan of this series when I say I can't wait!
I like this show very much

First four hours are kinda slow and introduce new, lame characters, such as a generic rich white bread family. The Kim and Reva storylines suck. It was a letdown that Season 2 did not start off with Jack hunting Nina- there is like a 1-1.5 year gap. Even President Palmer's arc in this time period is much slower and predictable than Season 1's (Eric? Come on).

But then things really pick up once returning characters come back. There are fantastic character actors as well. It is very addicting, shocking, and Palmer's arc is similar to JFK's during the Cuban Missile Crisis. There are many sad, emotional scenes with Jack, George, and Palmer. Jack really got in trouble this time and it really seems like he is a goner. Once again there is an unbelievable cliff hanger.

America is on the brink of a nuclear war with the Middle East in this suspense filled political thriller. David Palmer, the candidate from season 1, is now the president of the United States and must work with Jack Bauer, CIA agent to prevent a global war and  nuclear holocaust, supposed caused by terrorists who have planted a nuclear bomb, set to go off in Los Angeles that very day.

The action and suspense is unrelentless right up  until the final moment of the last episode.  There are many scenes of violence and brutal torture, plenty of plot twists and surprises, no time for even a bit of comedy relief. And there are lots of extra features, such as selected commentaries on several episodes, over 40 extended scenes, and features on the production and behind the scenes interviews, especially related to the final 2 episodes.

The Fox Network series entitled "24" is a post-9/11 counter-terrorism television program, which premiered in November, 2001, just two months after the terrorist attacks that occurred on September 11, 2001. This second season examines another 24-hour time period in the hectic life of Federal Agent Jack Bauer of the Los Angeles branch of the Counter-Terrorism Unit, known as the CTU, as he battles frantically to thwart yet another diabolical conspiracy. The novel structure of this groundbreaking television series involves each episode representing a single hour in this very action-packed and challenging day. The character of Agent Jack Bauer is portrayed perfectly by actor Kiefer Sutherland, who plays an old-fashioned tough guy, who utilizes any means necessary to vanquish the forces of evil. Of course, the rather aggressive and sometimes brutal methods of Agent Bauer often blur the distinction between good and evil. This second season of "24" continues to be decidedly intelligent, fast-paced, and suspenseful, and it is a superb combination of the political thriller and action/adventure genres. Its use of real-time plot development, and the innovative split-screen technique, are absolutely brilliant. The riveting intrigue and captivating plot twists keep the viewer totally enthralled, because one never really knows who can be trusted. This outstanding Counter-Terrorism series "24" is truly my all-time favorite television program, and I enthusiastically give Season 2 a five-star rating, along with my very highest recommendation!

There is no show like 24.  Jack Bauer is the most multi faceted character I have ever seen in anything.  The scope of this show takes the viewer into no man's land, on a run away train.  Jack Bauer is a father whose wife died IN the office he works in, killed by an agent who is only out for monetary gain.  The show is wickedly insane, as each hour represents an hour in real time, and when watching 3 to 4 hours at a time, you may just feel drained emotionally.  We have seen it before, and will see it again.  There is no better show for action, retribution, revenge, and finally redemption.

Of course, this is all about Jack who is a "die hard" hero. He has a great charisma and his willingness to do whatever it takes for his country is inspiring. But the Pres. Palmer in Season 2 is also very visible and convincing. Basically, these two are the ones who make the series so great. Sherry Palmer (Penny Johnson) was in her best repertoire but has finally done something good too so there is less reason to hate her for what she usually does. Of course, as usually in all action movies there are here some unlikely and doubtful scenes as well. The whole idea about Nina being connected to the nuclear threat is questionable, but the scene when she has been shot right at the moment when she got a permit to kill Jack is at all time low. Also, it's hard to believe that the President would forgive all his subordinates (but one) after such a massive orchestrated betrayal by his Cabinet members. Pres. Palmer plays a really strong character and this exceptionally soft reaction is not what may have been expected from him.
Overall the Season 2 has a good dynamics, a lot of mysterious situations where it is not easy to predict a next move. It's a great example of a good action cinema, for sure. I recommend it to everyone who is tired with fiction movies and fairy tales and wants to see a fight between the good and evil in more or less realistic circumstances.
UPDATE. How I could forget about George Mason (played by Xander Berkeley)? Xander made his character look extremely convincing. Pretty high ranking bureaucrat with some real career in a deep past once of a sudden transforms into a real hero literally saving millions of lives and (which is important too) - the life of Jack Bauer himself. It was very interesting to watch the development of this controversial character indeed and those were some of the most memorable scenes of the series.

I thought season 2 was great up until George Mason went down with the bomb. Once the bomb was no longer a threat, the writers seemed to struggle to find something to fill up the episodes remaining in the season. The George Mason story was the best part of the season for me and I loved that character. Xander Berkeley played him brilliantly. The scenes between George and Jack when he took over for Jack as the pilot and Jack saying good-bye to Kim were without a doubt the best and most emotional scenes of the season. After that drama, it was hard for anything else to top that. Michelle and Tony's relationship was the best part of the last few episodes in this season IMO.

The writers made a big error in not connecting Kim's story to the main plot. The psycho killer dad should have had some connection to the terrorists trying to bring in the bomb. Her story did get ridiculous, but they minimized it enough so it wasn't as annoying to me as it was to some others.

Overall, the season was good. Kiefer was great as always as were Penny Johnson Jerald and Sarah Clarke.

I wanted to like this show more. Many, many people loved it. It is good, don't get me wrong--it is well written, produced and acted, with decent production values and good locations and sets--a high-budget show filmed right in my backyard (my old office used to look right down onto the roof of the 24 soundstage in Woodland Hills when it was being filmed). I did not watch it then though, and finally this year (2016) decided to give it a whirl on Amazon Prime Video.

Sadly, I had to stop watching it. This is perhaps the single most anxiety-producing show I have ever encountered. Every episode feels like a 4-minute scene in ER, where they are frantically trying to save someone's life who happens to have a broken 2x4 protruding from their abdomen. Everything is *always* super-tense and very touch and go. Jack Ryan or someone important is always about to die. If you enjoy sitting on the edge of your seat and having your blood pressure elevated constantly, this is the show for you. I would have to conclude I am over that sort of thrill. I don't do roller coasters any more either, for the exact same reason. In fact, that is a good metaphor--this feels a lot like a roller coaster. After every episode, you have to take a break, catch your breath, and meditate or something to calm down. The stress this show produces is just not healthy. I am a psychotherapist, and I am qualified to make that statement.

This show invoked very high stress levels and kept my fight or flight response triggered continuously throughout every episode. There is no warm, fuzzy downtime for your system to relax and unwind unless you turn it off. Perhaps if watched as it originally aired--one episode at a time, spread apart over a week or at least a few days, this would be more manageable. Trying to binge-watch it however proved to be an exercise in cortisol overload tolerance. (Extended periods of high levels of cortisol in your system are terrible for you. That is exactly what this show does to you.)

24 is not about action (although I assure you, there is plenty). It is about trust, betrayal, greed, and poor decision making at every level. The message I got from watching almost three seasons of 24 before giving up was that you cannot trust *anyone* and everyone is at their core, a greedy, selfish idiot who will kill you if they need to. I stopped watching because at some point it was no longer entertaining for me. It felt more like having an argument with your spouse or your boss: frustrating, emotionally wrenching, stressful and perilous.

Initially, my impression of the show was that of of a non-stop avalanche of crisis' for Jack Ryan to figure his way out of, a lot like MacGyver, only more intense. After a while, it became just an exercise in stress, frustration and anxiety--it literally made me feel really upset and stressed out if I watched two episodes in a row. Frankly, I get enough of that in my work and the rest of real life. I would rather watch something less filled with betrayal and loss (warning: everyone betrays everyone constantly, and lots of people die often at the hands of someone they thought they knew and could trust). I'm thinking baseball.

Cheers,
Matt

The show fully exploits the idea of running out of time/running out of options as a device for the blockbuster genre. It uses every aspect of every character and interweaves the relationships.  So it's very exciting.  However, the narrow escape/goal interrupted device gets overworked and the script begins to feel too improvisational. In those places where the viewer is seeing 4 locations at the same time does not allow the viewer a chance to integrate the actions, no chance for the eye and the mind to rest.
The show is afraid of good male/female relationships and too many of the "good women" are blonde. The dark women are vicious (Sherry)
frustrated (Michelle) or dead (Claudia). The men get beat up,burned, shot, have surgery and recover entirely too quickly.

I love this show, but seriously, the whole 24 hours they are averting a disaster and nobody seems to be making any sense. Somehow, after 23.5 hours of drama and drama after drama, people start making he right decisions and the whole crisis is averted in less than 25 mins. I literally threw my remote and turned the TV off during one episode when they introduced more drama than was needed. Yes, I get it, you have to create a show, but the plot just kept dragging on and on. Additionally, if I'm wrong, Jack and pretty much everybody else didn't sleep or eat for the entire 24 hours, after being at work since before the day started. Events happening in real time is fun, but at times, they forget reality is still being felt in the progress. I know they aren't making this show anymore, but it just feels like too much to handle for the pleasure of watching.

As I began to watch this show I was drawn in by the 24 hour format. However, it became painfully clear that the  writers were taking the main characters down a path of unremarkable, unethical, immoral, dark, unbelievable, and frankly un-American  human beings.  I tried to look past the complete breakdown of family, friend, co-worker, the betrayals, the lying, cheating, disrespect, unclean, unrealistic recovery from injuries, the complete lack of believability in events.  The writers and producers should be ashamed. This show had few if any redeeming values.  By Season Two (more of the same)  I had  enough. Just plain crap. I recommend no one " put this garbage in there brain". Sad day for America that this show  made it to season eight.

The 24 series of shows isn't as funny (though there are a few funny moments), but is much more exciting than Indian Jones movies or any of the Lethal Weapons or 007 movies!  This series is constantly surprising me and has more twists and turns than a roller coaster ride but is as exciting! There's virtually no vulgarity or illicit sex scenes - just good, creative writing!  I could totaly see many of the scenarios and clashes (back scratching - trading favors) going down within government. My only con was that I wasn't fond of a few of the characters and WHY they would use such unprofessional people in the CTU even if they are on the spectrum. Other than that, Kiefer definitely carries the show along some other fabulous supporting actors that stuck with him in the later years that cae from/after the CTU.

I'm still binge watching but getting more annoyed at how many bad decisions these characters make. I wonder if the writers sit around and ask, what would a real person do in this situation? The write the story line to have them do exactly what most people would not do.

Jack for example for supposedly being this hero constantly makes stupid, ego driven and what seems amateurish errors. Oh, and for a show based on 24 hours in a day, no one ever sleeps but do mange to change clothes from time to time.

Last, his daughter, I can decide if she is the most unlucky person on the planet or incredibly stupid. She makes every wrong choice possible, ignores all common sense and acts like the dumb people on horror movies like when the silly girl who knows the killer is in the closet so she sets down her weapon, takes off half her clothes and then gets into the closet with the killer and lockers herself in. Jack's daughter makes these kinds of decisions.

Perhaps since I am binge watching the compression adds to the seemingly constant bad decisions and poor communications skills on the part of a group that are supposed to be experts however, I still keep watching like passing a terrible car wreck on the road, even as you feel bad for the people involved you still keep watching.

Absolutely riveting series! I don't care for political thrillers, but two of my friends, each with very different interest and taste,  recommended it, so I gave it a try and couldn't stop watching it. Fantastic writing, the happenings are very logical with full of surprises and twists. The hero, played by Kiefer Sutherland is outstanding.  I was only familiar with his name through his father, Donald Sutherland, who is one of the best actors of our time. However,  Kiefer is absolutely fantastic playing the agent, Jack Bauer proving that he is not just an action hero but someone who is capable of showing wide range of emotions and fragility. . The rest of the cast is just as good creating  unforgettable characters. I highly recommend it with the warning that this series is highly addictive!

Season 2, Episode 6 exhibits the most imaginative and credible screen writing I have ever seen. Kim Bauer, Jack's daughter, kidnaps a wife-beater's daughter in order to protect her from harm. Then, she gets into the car with the girl and her boyfriend thinking she will save the child and escape the nuclear disaster that is about to destroy LA. She doesn't know that Gary, the wife-beater has murdered his wife and stuffed her into the trunk of the car. Amazing plot twist. Reza, the good guy from the middle east is interrogated by Tony, the handsome guy from CTU. Reza has been framed by his bride to be and doesn't know it. Reza has done nothing wrong, but Tony breaks him by threatening to "perp walk" him in chains in front of his Middle East parents. Reza, then, implicates Bob, who is an innocent CIA agent. Marie and Kate, two sisters, and daughters of Bob freak out and start fighting with one another. Crazy Jack Bower shoots some jerk and saws his head off so that he can infiltrate a domestic terror group. Astonishing! He succeeds and finds out that they plan to blow up CTU. He warns Lynn Kresgie, a key presidential aid, who can't warn the president because he is too busy Molly-coddling and duping the press. CTU is blown up. Jack's boss gets zapped by plutonium. Nina Myers is implicated in the nuke plot. Jack almost shoots Nina. There is so much going on, but it all fits together. More amazingly, one subplot amplifies another until the whole episode resonates with suspense, intrigue, betrayal, violent action, and most importantly disinformation and misinformation. Some viewers may think they know what is going on, but they are wrong. You know you are in for the unexpected when Sherry, President Palmer's wife, shows up. This lying, conniving, power crazy woman will spin the President of the US and get away with it. Watching this episode was like being thrown into a raging river filled with rocks, trees, snakes, and frothing white water. I fell for every trick and trap that the writers and  directors set for me. In school, my professors talked about "the willing sense of disbelief" necessary for successful drama. With characters like Marie, Nina, and Sherry there is no willing sense of disbelief; there is, instead, a willing feeling of victimization. I was as duped and confused as Bob Warner and I was as committed as Plutonium George Mason. Episode 6 of Season 2 is art.

This is an incredibly entertaining series many years after it originally ran. Although it includes a lot of violence, it is not only the bad guys committing it.  I get the urge to stand up and cheer when the bad guy gets a bullet through the forehead. Jack Bauer does what he must to protect the homeland and the politically correct bull waste can go straight to you know where.  There are no gratuitous f-bombs being hurled around and the series is all the better for it.  There is a lesson here for Hollywood, but I suspect they are not bright enough to see it.  Series of this high caliber are rare and completely absent in this day and age.

Even though Season 2 was pretty good, it had some doldrums in the later hours.  There were better seasons!  There were points where I felt they were just treading water, with content expanded just to fill the time slot. Still, it gets back on track. Overall, I'd say it begins and ends well, but there are some hours you may just want to skim over.

I wish half the shows that came out today were at least half as good.

Although Season 2 was thrilling, it was not as suspenseful as season 1.  I still do not understand why they keep the character Kim in this series.  She only provides examples of silly and dumb teenage activity (or non-activity) that takes away from the action that Jack is involved with. Maybe Season 3 eliminates this character altogether.

Otherwise, Season 2 introduces many situations and plots that I felt were unnecessary to keeping the main theme (nuclear bomb threat) in play.  Maybe they were just stretching it out to cover 24 hours.  In either case, the series is still thrilling and exciting and it keeps you rooting for Jack at every turn.

I'm excited to see what season 3 has to bring to the series.

I thought Season 1 of "24" was an incredibly intense, superbly written thriller.

And, indeed, it was!

I did not think it possible, but Season 2 has actually FAR exceeded the writing and acting qualities, intensity and stress levels, and the perfect casting of the various characters over and above Season 1. As of this writing, I have two Episodes remaining to watch of Season 2.  I did not watch this Series when it was first aired. All of my viewing of it has either been here on Amazon's Prime Video, or its popular competitor which no longer streams the Series. Way back when, a co-worked asked me ONCE, if I were watching it, but he never even hinted as to how incredibly good it was. Series like this are so rare, in that here is top notch, text book quality in EVERY facet of its production.

I love it (and I hate it at the same time) for mercilessly reaching out of my Flatscreen TV, and grabbing me by the throat, and then not letting me move from my chair. "Binge watching" helps relieve some of the stress. I am somewhat glad that I didn't watch it and get hooked when it originally aired: I could not stand to wait a week for the next episode.

My hat is off to the writers, cast and crew for this phenomenal, superbly-crafted Series.
Can't go wrong with this one!!

This series is seductive in its action and violence.  It is interesting that the show was produced around the same time enhanced interrogation techniques (aka torture) were being secretly used.  It aired at the same time when our anger about the 9/11 attacks was still raw.  In fictional action/violence stories like 24 hours, the bad guys are worse than the worst evil one can imagine, torture is always justified, and torture always brings good intelligence that saves the lives of innocent people.  I guess I have seen this type of story one too many times, and it embarrasses me that it could hold my attention at one time.

24 Season 2 has a transmission bug in all of its episodes. You can listen to it with analog TV sound outputs. If you use a digit fiber cable from your TV audio output the digital audio does not work.  24 Season 1, any episode works fine. Season 2 is messed up with the digital transmission of the Audio signal.

UPDATE: It turns out Season 2 is configured for 5.1 Audio for 6 channel surround sound. If you are using a Roku go to Roku Settings - Audio - select STEREO.  Audio will now operate through digital fiber S/PDIF.

You just knew she couldn't be trusted, which made one wonder why Jack gave her just a little too much trust.  He should have known better. And I grew quite fond of George Mason and was very proud the way he grew so much in such a short time. All in all, not the greatest 24 Season, but better than most every other series that has been around i recent years.

I Used to enjoy 24 when I watched it occasionally. Now, having the time and capability to watch the entire series, episode by episode; the entire premise seems far-fetched. You begin to realize that all the incidents that occur in a twenty-four hour period could not possibly occur. The most glaring issues are how stupid Jack Bauer's daughter really is. She has no common sense and gets involved in all sorts of issues because of this. Also, since the series takes place in Los Angeles; it is hard for me to fathom that the CTU people could drive around the city, known for it's traffic problems, so effortlessly.

Season 2 is set 18 months after season 1, and the stakes are much higher than a simple assassination attempt and revenge.  There is a nuclear device on American soil and Jack Bauer must attempt to save the day once again.  The plot goes at a quicker pace and leaves you breathless much more often.  So much happens in a 24 hour period, but none of it gets to be too much.  Tony and Michelle both get a lot of air time and brings their characters more into the 24 world.  President Palmer is at his best in this season, as well as his ex-wife Sherry.  There a new characters added and the threat of traitors around every corner.  Because of the events in Season 1, you don't know who to trust and who not to, so you're pulled along for the ride until the writers want you to know what's really going on.  From the first to the last episode, this is as engrossing a season of television as there is.  The re-watch value is also great.  If you weren't hooked after Season 1, then Season 2 will definitely do it.  This will clearly get you ready for Season 3.

Season 2 stretches the boundaries of plausibility and overindulges in random subplots.  Really?  A waif like creature is a terrorist and the president's wife just waltzes in and conspires against him behind his back but right under his nose.  Geez.  As usual, the show is well done, but just feels like a random set of unfortunate events.  What exactly IS the point of Kimberly's ordeal?  Also, the show's producers mix and match "middle eastern" ethnicities without any regard to cultural reality.  Iranians and Arabs are interchangeable which is stupid.  Of course, Kiefer is great, and well, that's why we watch!

I guess if I had started watching this show years ago when it was fresh and new and innovative, I might have given it 5 stars. After recently watching some other spy shows (Covert Affairs, Homeland, e.g.) I have higher expectations of 24's plots and characters.  Although the show has plenty of action, season two was a bit too formulaic and predictable for me to laud.  There were too many moments when it's obvious that some imminent danger could be avoided if only the character would do "x" instead of "y".  Particularly annoying is that for the most part, the women characters are either portrayed as weak (and not too bright) or as villains while the men, mostly Jack, the superhero, are almost psychic and mucho macho.  Towards the end of the season, at least two women are given a chance to be heroic and not overly dense and girlie.  It is still entertaining - don't get me wrong.  I'm just starting season three and hope the head writer has finally put his divorce or breakup with his girlfriend behind him.

Not much time to breathe in between the hours in the day!! presented as each part of the entire season (the whole show represents one 24 hr period) Very fast -paced show with many mini-disasters going on at any hour of the day-or show! Some of it is difficult to follow-there will be scenes  in Los Angeles, Mexico and Washington maybe interspersed with Europe-vaguely related to the main story of the show. The way the writers interweave the dangers to characters, the connections and the results is interesting-I find myself hoping this is all fantasy-or at least a STORY-- as there is a lot of scary stuff going on in the government, politics, in the agencies which are supposed to be protecting the country. If there is some truth to this story, we are in trouble!

The production is very well planned. I watched the entire series several times. Interest is increased by several actions often occurring almost simultaneously. Very little swearing and no obscene language. The enemies of America are serious and intelligent, not silly as in some films. "Done in real time" is an interesting novelty. Events are realistic and completely understandable. They could have happened only in the USA.

And he can do it with a high degree of dexterity, possessing the ability to converse in the midst of smoke and rubble, gunfire and piles of bodies with the President of the United States, advising him of the best way to engage our numerous enemies in a quick thinking, highly articulate manner. I find myself awake at 2 am, glued to the seat of my recliner, watching 2 or 3 episodes. Thank you Amazon, for making this series available to Prime viewers.

Plot is good, acting is great but you need to really be willing to suspend reality! Just one example: A guy who is in police custody on murder charges some how ends up back in own house where he kills a cop who is waiting for Kim for gather up her things. When Kim encounters him she manages to knock him out and then, instead of dialing 911 who does she call? Her father Jack, who tells her what? Not "Call 911" but "shoot him!" So she does (twice). Then who does Jack call to go pick her up? Not the police, but a woman he's known for less than 24 hours (remember there's a dead cop out on the driveway). So Kate agrees to get her and when she gets there, what do they do? They simply leave. Two dead guys in the house and they just leave! Now maybe, if you shoot someone and you're afraid of being charged with murder, out of fear, you might run and try to hide. But that's not what goes on. The 2 women get in the car and casually drive away like it's no big deal. Never mind that Kim was just attacked and she shot a man. Never mind that there's a dead cop on the driveway. And then they end up having a 'heart to heart girl talk' in the car about mothers and loss and love.  Really??? Only on 24.

24 is without a doubt entertaining and can even be addictive at times. However, it's not a perfect show. For a show that has the suspense, but also has amazing writing and characters, check out Homeland.

The show only works because of Jack Bauer. Bauer is the only reason I keep watching. Bauer is the only well-fleshed out character and he's the only one to remain consistent throughout the show. Too often the writers created contrived scenarios and conflicts that depended on either the actors falling out of character, or some one-dimensional character doing  some asinine thing. Example, the last part of season 2's conflict depended on Tony being against rechecking the authenticity of a recording after some doubt was raised. This recording would be responsible for waging war in 3 countries. Yet, Tony was adamant about not wanting to recheck the recording because the terrorist who denied the authenticity could not be trusted. Yet, if Tony was onboard from the get go, it wouldn't have taken much time or energy to recheck the tapes. but since he wasn't, Jack had to go through all this crap to prove the recording was fake. This whole thing was so silly: 1) Up to this point, was a reasonable and responsible person, I don't believe his character would have really been so adamant about keeping Jack and Michelle from rechecking the tapes when he knew what was at stake. 2) The terrorist who said that the recording was fake, also said that he was in another country when the tapes were made---no one even bothered checking this. 3) I really hope our county is not run by such morons that are so quick to wage war based on uncertain evidence.

I want to add that season 2 proved George Mason to be a great character, but I'm not sure if that's really due to the writing as much as the actor being really good at delivering his lines.

The women on this show for season 1 and 2 are poorly written. Either this show never had a female staff writer or the ones they chose were afraid to say something because this show takes the cake when it comes to worst female characters. I'm not saying this because many of the women on this show turn out to be villains (which is fine within itself), but because the women on this show seem to have no reason or motivation as to why they do the things they do. At first it seems like Sherry Palmer wants to protect her son in Season 1, but it quickly becomes clear that she doesn't really care about her family as much as she cares about their public appearance, and this is never fully explained. By season 2 and 3 she's involved in terrorist activity and murder, and her children are never mentioned. Nina Myers is a full-blown psychopath it seems, but even so, as viewers we need to know something about her to make her interesting. But no, we know anything about her. The only thing that makes her on-screen presence interesting in season 2 and 3 is Jack Bauer's hatred for her. Kim Bauer has gone through a lot, but yet, she doesn't seem to learn anything as she makes one bad decision after another. Kate Warner, in season 2 pretty much irritated me every time she opened her mouth...especially after she learned that her sister was involved in the nuclear bomb. Lynn from Season 2 is an intelligent woman, but the writers had her make terrible decisions that eventually landed her in the hospital.

Things improved a little bit in season 3 with Michelle, and Chloe has a bigger role in season 4 which I'm excited about because so far she's the only female on the show to make me smile. I hope things will improve as I continue to watch.

What can you say about 24 Season 2 that hasn't been said before. That, of course, is a rhetorical question which goes to show just how popular all of the seasons of 24 are. Season 2 of 24 was a cliffhanger all the way through. It is classic 24 with is multiple subplots, all of which could have been the main plot for other TV shows. However, the main thing about season 2, as it is for all  9 seasons, is Jack Bauer. There had never been a character like Jack Bauer on TV; or in the movies. Moreover, it is only the rare actor who has so totally created a character as close to the perfection as Kiefer Sutherland did with Jack Bauer. Season 2 of 24 took the horror of a nuclear bomb to the soil of America in a riveting, edge of the seat possibility that one was so stressed by the end that it was a relief when the Day 2 ended. Yet, when Day 3 started, you came back for another frenetic, rollercoaster ride. Jack Bauer inhabited a world of unthinkably, extreme possibilities. Idealism, courage, nobility, fortitude, moral goodness, and altruism define a hero. Jack Bauer was just exactly the hero such a world needed. I can't recommend 24 Season 2 highly enough.

It's easy to understand why this show had such a strong fan base.

How is any Day of "24" not awesome?  Of course, Jack Bauer is the most admirable of modern heroes, and Kiefer Sutherland gives another perfect performance, having to step up to the call of the very job that made him a widower.  But I also admire the character arc of CTU boss George Mason, (Xander Berkeley plays this character so masterfully, one of my favorite characters), a middle manager-type, finds his true self, and comes thru like a champ.  I really liked Kate Warner, (played by Sarah Wynter), a caring woman who found the courage to brave a number of situations, simply because it was the right thing to do.  Was kinda hoping she'd wind up as "Mrs. Jack," but she was certainly a strong, memorable character and integral to making this season, Day 2, a winner!

There is always a minion who does the opposite of what the president wants,  the female minion who can't speak up for herself, the stupid daughter who doesn't listen and makes bad decisions (like getting out of the car instead of driving over the bad daddy), and the Jack Bauer cowboy solutions that make it worse  and then worse again before it gets better.  At least they killed the wife off at the end of season 1.  Should have killed the daughter too.  Who writes such annoyingly stupid women?  Of course half of the episodes would be missing without their inane actions.

For anyone wanting REALLY good domestic spy action, check out Spooks from the UK.  IT was slick and action-packed and incredibly well acted and written with the added bonus that you never knew who would get killed off.  Or if more action is for you, better to watch Strike Back, also mostly British about an SAS team operating in various international locales.  24, in contrast is formulaic and repetitive, filled with cliche characters and did I say repetitive?  I repeat......

Jack Bauer is certainly a man's man. This guy can survive gunshots and heart attacks with no discernible decrease in performance. All in a day's work, I guess. I suspect between seasons he just hibernates to heal up. Even more amazing is his daughter. She goes through more trauma in one day than most soldiers do on tour in Afghanistan. And still no evidence of PTSD. And no evidence she got any smarter since the last episode. If Ozzie and Harriet exemplified the "hyper-real" family stereotype, 24 exemplifies the effects of playing Call of Duty once the fetus develops thumbs. Exciting to watch. Requires suspension of belief in the norms of biology and psychology.

I've gone to movies before, shelled out my 10 bucks and left the theater disappointed.  This happens more frequently these days.  Often action adventures are just preparing you to see the sequel which is the same formula replayed over and over.  I'm tired of it and finding  there is not that much that is entertaining enough to warrant the expense.  However, after watching all of Season 1 and 1/2 way through season 2, of 24,  I realized that I'd gotten such a thrill ride from this show  it exceeds some of my happier moments in any theater.  Today I realized my whole Prime membership, if I did nothing else this year, was worth it to be able to this show.

If I was walking out of a theater this would be one my "that was worth it" moments.  My only complaint so far is that women in the rolls are either weak, stupid and getting into ridiculous situations because of that, are traitorous and conniving.  As a mother to young women, I like to see  females  portrayed as courageous and strong as the male protagonist.  Film has always been done this way so 24 didn't invent that characterization, that criticism aside, this is an edge of the seat, incredibly entertaining show with less silliness and fluff of anything else on TV

I know this series has been out for ages, but I've just gotten around to watching. Season one was enjoyable overall, but rather than fine-tune the series, the writers threw it all out the window and basically started all over again. Not in a good way.

They should have filmed the series in 24 hours, so that the characters in ep. 24 are really fatigued and showing the signs of exhaustion (including 5 o'clock shadow, impaired motor skills, bad judgment)...

President Palmer was apparently born to be duped. He is not suspicious at all when his ex-wife shows up at the presidential compound. Peeved perhaps, but that's about it. When she suddenly has all sorts of expertise, contacts and information on the bad guys in the NSA, he's not the least bit surprised, but instead reminisces about the good old days, and how she could really be on top of things.

Once Palmer discovers that a group within the NSA was trying to push him to war, and helped smuggle a nuclear device into the country, he should have shut the entire saber-rattling enterprise down. Since it's obvious the baddies in his own government were pushing for war, one would think he would assemble his cabinet and make clear what had happened, and what he would NOT do (ie go to war). Whether a foreign government played a role in this or not, the MAJOR problem is that Palmer has a cabal of traitors in his own government, and needs to be finding out who is loyal. Then start house cleaning.

The plot is obviously lifted from "Seven Days in May" and "Sum of All Fears", but doesn't synthesize the two plausibly. In the end Palmer faces a real dilemma when the proof comes through that foreigners WEREN'T responsible for the attack. How can he explain that, credibly, to the American people? Haven't watched the last episode yet (shudder) but we'll see.

I find the graphic nature of the torture scenes gratuitous. We get the point. Move on. The gunplay is ridiculous. Good guys making 50 yard snap shots, scoring one-hit kills on baddies on rooftops. But baddies hosing automatic fire and scoring no hits (except on the one guy who has info to stop the war).

Between the first and second seasons, someone apparently hired a PC consultant. The real bad guys appear to be evil white militias and conservatives in the government, and in the wake of the bomb's detonation, the government seems excessively concerned with protecting American Muslims, to the point of sending in the national guard. Rather than get on TV and speak directly to the American people and simply ask that in the name of decency that people remain calm. I know, probably wouldn't work, much better to mobilize the armed forces so they can fight Americans and the "Middle East" simultaneously.

The cloying way in which the writers carefully show us that Islam is a religion of peace, and then shift the focus to domestic intolerance is cloying and preachy. I wish people would stop assuming that Americans don't know that not all Russians, Chinese, Muslims, North Koreans, etc. are evil. Just tell the story and get it done.

Finally, I missed the part where Palmer actually made an announcement to the American people that a nuclear device had detonated. His silence leads to panic and civil disorder. Imagine if he had gone on the horn right away and announced that facts had indicated it was a training accident. People would have been concerned, but no panic. If he later finds out it's a terror attack, he can then correct the record. He seems ineffective, not in control of his government, and frankly a dangerous leader. Contrast that with President Lyman in "Seven Days in May" who was politically-astute and decisive.

Our standards, either in presidents or screenwriters, have plummeted.

I didn't have the schedule to follow "24" when it aired. But it's become such an enduring cultural touchstone, features a parade of good actors (Dennis Haysbert!), and is so conveniently streaming on Prime, that I decided to dive in.  I am amazed at just how bad it is.

"24" is poorly written. When you watch the episodes in blocks (OK, binges), the shallowness of the characters, and the repetitiveness of the story-lines, situations and dialog all become painfully evident.

Season 1 started out with a decent amount of drama and suspense, but soon, the constant unfurling of horrible events became monotonous. Season 2 was preposterous, with the writers resorting  to episodes filled with violence-porn and far-fetched situations full of plot holes... no, plot canyons...all depending on Jack Bauer to resolve.

OH, and in perusing the reviews here on Amazon, I see I'm not the only one who kept thinking, "No functional adult would make such a ridiculous decision," or who was astonished by the Darwin Award-worthy judgment-impairment of Jack's daughter, Kim.

There ARE lessons to be learned from this show, however.  Here are a few key principles:

- Women are conniving, evil, or wildly self-absorbed--unless they are admirers of Jack Bauer;

- Even the most treacherous men have soft spots--usually evinced by a dawning realization of Jack Bauer's greatness;

- Torture is good when it's inflicted by Jack Bauer or President Palmer (whose rectitude is demonstrated by his unwavering admiration for Jack Bauer), and bad when it's inflicted--in pretty much the same way--by anyone else.

-On one hand, unless it's Jack Bauer or an admirer of his giving the orders, chain of command is restrictive, petty and wielded by people who are corrupt or inept.  On the other hand, unless you're Jack Bauer or his admirer President Palmer, thinking for yourself or acting on your own always leads to unbelievably terrible outcomes...which Jack Bauer will promise to fix.

My first instinct was to give this show one star, except that there is something I have to confess:  in spite of how laborious it is, and of how much eye-rolling I've done watching it,  "24" is clearly addictive.  I am, after all, writing this review having watched 48 episodes that I could not stop myself from watching.  So, for that I'll give it an extra star, but ask if anyone knows of a meeting nearby.
Constantly keeps you guessing, I still think season 1 is the best season of all but this is one of my all-time favorite TV shows.

Also, not bad to start philosophical discussions with the family - there are deep questions about the ethics of war, the limits of executive power in our constitutional republic.  See it and you'll understand the issues at hand.

The second year of the thriller series 24 takes the viewer on a hard look at the urgency with which a nuclear threat to this nation might take, with a well-written script, good effects, and a musical score that provides a superb backdrop for the action taking place on the screen.  The character who plays George Mason was outstanding as he came to grips with his impending death following exposure to a lethal dose of plutonium following a firefight inside a warehouse where terrorists assembled the bomb.
With this series, you know what to expect when you bring the series on line, and it produces everything you would expect and more.  Great follow up to Season One -- Jack Bauer fans (and fans of all the peripheral cast members) will not be disappointed!

What's not to like about 24? Jack Bauer is the man!!!  Nobody messes with Jack!!  Each episode continues to ramp up the excitement.  Some say it's predictable, but I can't imagine where they're coming from.  Major characters aren't safe, no matter how important they are to the show (save Jack that is).  Plot twists come fast and heavy.  Is there any wonder why the show was so immensely popular?  If you've never watched, all I can say is, "Buckle your seat belts.  You're in for quite a ride."  Can't wait for the upcoming 2014 version!!!

There are so many OMG moments in each episode. To fill an entire show with just 1 hour in a specific day seems impossible but they carry it off impeccably. I wish my husband would stay up all night so we could watch more episodes but he does have to go to work. A must see for all
Exciting and kept me on the edge of my seat, preparing for jack is back. Can't wait to see the next season

Watched the first season and didn't understand what was the big deal about this program.  We are almost finished with the second season and we can't still figure what the big deal was.

It is basically a 2 hour show stretched into 24 episodes with a lot of filler that makes you want to bang your head against the wall.  Very predictable.  Severely over rated.

Edit: Finished the season last night.  Not often that I can't wait until a series is over so I don't have to think about it again.  Wife and I were about to fall asleep in the last hour.  Very predictable.  Too many plot items that are contrived and illogical.  Wife would have given it 0 stars.

Some annoyances:
Someone is shot from a sniper, in a helicopter but didn't here it.
Everything is only 15 minutes away.  This was based in LA.  How is that possible?
Too many people that are doing the wrong thing.

This is one of the best series that has ever been on TV.  I watched it on Fox years ago and now am catching up with it on Amazon Prime, getting ready for "Jack coming back!"  You will not be disappointed in Season 2.
I've really enjoyed watching the 24 seasons. The are awesome and thrilling to watch. It's addicting to watch and hard to stop.

T. Jackson
Love the show. Watch it everyday until the weee hours of the morning. Just a wonderful show. awesome
Wanted to continue with the series.  Bringing Sherry back into play was forced an unrealistic.  Guess actors and actresses need the money.
Tense!  I finished all 24 sessions in  6 days.  I enjoyed them this time more than when I had to wait one week to get my dose of CTU.
I really enjoy this show. There are a few far farfetched parts which is why I gave it a 4. , but the story line is really good, acting is great and the seasons are getting better.
Good plot but to think the entire series happens in only 24 hours is a little hard to believe. This makes for the story line to drag a little. Still a good show.
One of the best shows ever.  I like the story and acting. I love the "real time" aspect of the storytelling.  I didn't care for the subplot with Kim, but that's a relatively minor complaint.

Lots of action, good acting, want to see other seasons too...

A day like it is in the movie would be  exhausting
My favorite show hands down. Takes TV to another level can't wait for 24 Live Another Day #JackBauer Best Agent
Best show ever. A little far fetched sometimes, but the storyline and action are awesome. Love all the characters. Yeah
Perfectly clear images. The action in this series is addicting. I am sorry it had to go off the air but as they say, "All good things must come to an end!"
We really liked season one, but season two wasn't quite as good.  Had some slow spots, but overall, I would reccomend
The 1st season i could see camera men in the shots and a lot of the scenarios were sketchy, but they cleaned it up in the 2nd season.

Jack Bower does a outstanding job.  Each season gets better than the last!!!

Can't wait to see next season!
THANKS
Great action packed terrorist fighting show, if you don't know of Jack Bauer you gotta at least watch one season

Very clever plot and presentation.  Although one has to suspend disbelief for much of the scenario, the program is very entertaining and extremely well designed to keep the viewer on the edge of his/her seat.
24 pulls you in and keeps you going from one episode to the next! I still take weekends and watch nonstop to the end!
I really enjoy watching this series.  Unfortunately episodes 20 and 21 have been prevented from streaming for some reason on my kindle.

If you have Amazon Prime, watch this show.  If you don't, buy it.  It will be worth every penny you spend on it.  What a remarkable show, full of action, suspense, and wonderful acting.  Keifer Sutherland is magnificent.  I love it more and more.  I watched 2 seasons in 3 days, and just finished the third.  I don't know what I will do when I am finished with it, but perhaps I will watch it again.

As always, suspenseful with shocking twists. However, the storyline with Kim Bauer is getting old and annoying and brings down the momentum of the show. It has gotten to the point where I just want to fast forward every time she is on the screen. She always finds herself in unnecessary drama and trouble.

Great "24" suspense, but the Kim storyline gets tiresome.  Her life is the modern-day "Perils of Pauline."

This isn't a criticism of the show per se, but why is Amazon missing episode #17?  Very disconcerting when you're trying to follow a continuous story.
==============================================================
Postscript (half-day later): Episode 17 is now back online.  Did I have anything to do with that?
Waited too long to watch this series.  Now hooked.  Second season as good if not better than the first. Losing sleep staying up late to see just one more episode.
Amazing!! Just the best show ever done and can't wait for the return in March 2014. I wished they did make the movie.
It is hard to believe that a show is that good! I am deeply impressed. I have never seen a better show.

Season 2 was still entertaining ,  however it's a pity that the creator(s) of the series exaggerate
the story with all the events happening one after another and in such a way , that makes it all less
credible.
Of course it's done to keep the viewer(s) glued to their seat, while sweating and trembling of
suspense , but  I guess that more emphasis on the main story -the possible war- would have been a plus.
But o.k., it was entertaining.
This show is addicting! We loved Season 1 - and Season 2 is shaping up to be just as riveting!
The suspense is nonstop and engaging.  I find myself watching one episode after another back to back.  Fabulous acting by Keifer Sutherland
Show is fantastic .  HD picture quality is awful. Running it through via PS3. Stream through this method all the time without reduced picture quality.
What a great series this was origanilly and it was so good to review it again.  Acting was great and it held your interest throughout the program..thank you for making it possible again,,

I never watched this series while it was on live; guess it came too close after 9/11 as if the country wasn't scared enough, right!  Anyway, it's a decent program but I think the story line at times is a bit weak or predictable.  All that considered, I intend to keep watching it but am not sure about the upcoming movie or it's going live again on network tv.  All-in-all, it's a good program.
Never a dull moment. Very few spots to catch your breath. Hard to stop watching the episodes. Fun marathon session.
Action never stops. Not your typical agent, Bauer doesn't believe in rules.never know what's going to happen next. Great shiw

This show is an amazing work of art.  I have watched all 8 seasons twice and expect to watch them again sometime in the future.  The Los Angeles Counter Terrorism Unit confronts one terrorism threat after another.  Although extremely violent at times, I get the feeling that the threats could easily be real either now in the future.  All the characters are credible, and clearly differentiated from each other.

We were tired of reruns and limp programming on 'regular' TV.  When '24' was running, I heard many friends talk about this 'not to miss' show. So, I thought, 'let's give it a try'.  We were hooked in the middle of the first episode of season 1 and have watched no less than three episodes at each sitting.  So glad to not have to wait for 'next week' to find out what happens next!
My favorite show!  Keeps you on the edge of your seat from suspense.  Hope they revive this show, hated to see it go.
Still a good show to watch but, don't allow youth in the room.  This is for adult viewing only, please.
This is a show that keeps you on your toes with twists and turns great to watch at any time

This is the best TV series, there is so much action,  you get involved with all the characters.
Jack Bauer is awesome.  I have watched this series a number of times and it holds my interest.

In parts a bit slow...Get tired of daughter constantly getting into situations.  All in all very interesting plot...Started 3rd season...feel asleep after first show...Tired of constant trauma situations.

Wow! Each episode is full of action and twists & turns.  Puts you on the edge of your seat throughout each episode.  Have a difficult time going to bed, at times, because we want to see what happens next.  One must watch from first season episode or you will miss the role and purpose of each character, which is definitely important.  We're only in the 4th season, and we are always ready to squeeze in another episode (via Amazon).
  (We tried to watch this years ago and dismissed it as too confusing because we viewed an episode far in the future of the first season and were not aware of all the characters or past plots.  We never watched it again until "Amazon" came into our life.)  Once again, start with the First Season and First Episode and continue throughout.  If you like quality action, you will be happy with "24"!

Very action packed - interesting how they intertwine four different family and lives into a one hour real time account.
Whenever I watch it - it is a cliff hanger at the very end- something that makes you want to tune in again and again!
I've always loved this show. Now I'm catching myself up to prepare for the new season! Can't wait for May!
Great show. Exciting plot, adrenaline rush every episode!!! Each episode contains a twist and turn. Never a dull moment. Must watch!
This is the most excellent movie, keeps you attention and very enjoyable. it's nice to watch a movie that is not full of cuss words, Love it, love it, love it !

I am having so much fun re-watching the all of the seasons of "24" in anticipation of the up coming season. It's still as riveting and exciting as it was way back when. Can't get enough of it. Go Jack!

I love the nail biting suspense. Love the characters. How do they manage to look so appealing and hot under such extreme circumstances? And the show asks us to question how much violence is it ok for our government to perpetuate?
Great program. Keeps you interested. There's always something going on and multiple situations that are being dealt with. Jack Rocks!!!
I have been watching this because I joined Amazon Prime. I have enjoyed watching it on my computer and haven't had any problems during viewing.

Not as gripping as the first season  and also at times seemed predictable line for instance the moment Jack's boss contacted the radiation it was obvious he would die trying to put his life ahead of Jacks. Nevertheless the plot chosen was good and good performances by many.

I like season 2 better than season 1.  My  only issue is, it goes on and on with one disaster after another.  You are pretty involved and then you just stop caring.  If you ask me it is about 4 shows to long.
You will enjoy watching Jack Bauer's daughter yet again make every poor decision one human can make in 24 hours.
Intense, best show on TV at the time. Love the technology stuff that is now common. Looking forward to season 3!
I enjoyed it every minute of it, and I am looking forward to watch the third season. I recommended to a few friends, and they are hook on it.
wish they would bring back the tv show and make movies.  they would be a hilt like the bourne movies.
Excellent kept me on my toes the whole time. Watched the whole season in two days because I could not wait for the next episode.
This seasons offerings simply lacked nothing for those that like the terrorist/espionage genre. It has almost non-stop tension interspersed with pathos and keeps you glued to the set.
Have a lot of plots going on at the same time, untense despite long deama series. Very well made with tight story progression.

It is an Awesome show!
I wold love to see more of 24 but there are only 8 Seasons.
Best show on T.V.
Very exciting show.  I am always anticipating the next episode and can't wait to see what happens next.  Well worth watching.
I cannot stop watching 24! Excellent show. Far fetched sometimes but Keifer Sutherland makes it believable. That is genius acting.
Whether you are new to '24' or watching the episodes again in anticipation for the new "24, Live Another Day" series, this series keeps you engaged in suspense. Highly recommended!
I plan to use these episodes to view "24" in order.  I missed some shows. Now I cansee all shows in order.
I absolutely enjoy this series! It is a facinating event! I thoroughly enjoyed the journey of each 24 hours in the life of Jack Bauer! Wonderful series!! Looking forward to the rest of the seasons...
This is an awesome action packed thriller with FBI CTU action, drama, and human emotions. A must see and to follow through.
Better than season 1.  Superbly suspenseful and well acted.  I am re-watching every season to get ready for season 9 coming this summer!
Not as good as Season 1. I felt it drag a little in the middle but still love Jack Bauer.
I LOVE the series 24. Outstanding acting, story line, intensity & I believe the writers deserve kudos! Quality TV viewing.

This entire season kept me very interested. On a whole, it wasn't quite as good as Season 1. But it's amazing how they can keep the plot so involved and make 24 hours seem like months. I had to keep reminding myself that when a wound isn't healing, for example, it's because it's taking place on the same day. Some of it seems a bit over the top, maybe a lot over the top, but Keifer Sutherland's acting is superb, nonetheless.
This is one of the best thrilling series I have ever seen. Keeps you tight to the chair and something happening all the time. People who like thrillers are going to love it
Spectacular show! 24 drastically changed the standard of acting and filmography for television action/dramas, setting a blockbuster movie quality standard on the small screen.
Very engaging and its so good you can hardly stop watching it. You will want to watch every episode in a row!
24's second year is fabulous. If you don't like binge watchiong, don't order this. You will not be able to stop watching. It goes from crisis to crisis. What a ride.

So many series deteriorate, especially in the quality of writing, after a successful season or two.  I'm happy to say "24" did not.  The characters remain finely drawn, the acting is first-rate, and the writing is tight, dialogue believable, plotting is current, and the whole production is immensely satisfying.
Still worth watching...even though it's been several years since it went off the air- I still enjoy revisiting Jacks adventures.
How did I miss this addictive show the first time around?  I'm just glad I can watch it whenever I want.
went back to play catchup with 24, one of my all time favorite series with 24 coming back in 2014 for a run. looking forward

I'm still playing catch up on this series.  So far I'm loving it!  Lots of action and it keep you wanting to see more!  Been late for work twice trying to look at as many episodes as possible at night.
Season 2 of 24 is a masterpiece. Jack Bauer is at in again and this time trying to save the world from a nuclear attack.

There has never been a show like it in the history of television.  24 assaults your sensibilities regarding terrorism, national security, ethnic profiling while carefully and pruposefully infusing it with back stories and side stories wonderfully crafted to provide enough insight into the personal struggles of all of the characters, while not taking anything away from the impact of the drama unfolding in real-time across every scene.

Tense,gripping, gut wrenching action that WILL cause you to force your emiotional guage needle to redline from zero - instantly at times.  Jack Bauer and CTU are OFF THE CHAIN!  The citizens of the USA inside the world of this wonderfully crafted drama should be very proud of how their tax dollars are spent on protecting their lives and constitution.

Well...there are a few times where the Constitution does get shredded like yesterday's incriminating email though...ALL in the auspices of national security nonetheless!  LOL!!  This show is the most fun to watch and is the gold standard for other shows that have come after it.  "Homeland" and the like, while powerful and updated, have to pay homage to the one that set it off...24, baby!!

I was very excited to order this for a friend who had never seen 24 and kept talking about it after seeing a couple of episodes on TV. His main complaint was how it stopped right at the good part and he didn't really know when it would run again. I decided to look it up on Amazon and purchased him the first 4 seasons. He is loving it.

We now own the first six seasons and the price at Amazon was great!  There were no digital flaws in any of the 24 DVDs.

Paul Baragona  Raleigh, NC  USA
Have only seen two episodes so far, but you can't possibly watch season 1 and then quit.  What is there to watch today - some pathetic reality show?  24 makes TV worth watching.
I have watched so much movie and TV shows in Amazon prime in the last 2 years. This is the best tv show ever. The story is so riveting that I can't stop watchinh

Twists, turns,, conspiracies, counter-conspiracies, unpredictable ends and non-stop thrills and suspense till the very end. I watched it 'marathon' on Amazon Prime and couldn't stop. VERY addictive.
Great acting by Kiefer Sutherland and every single other actor - amazing direction and editing.
In my book, one of the top shows I have ever had the opportunity to watch.
I have now watched all of 24 and each episode would keep me breathless waiting to see what would happen! The twists and turns so great. I can even watch from the beginning again!

My best friend and I decided to watch 24 from the very beginning.  Season two was awesome.  It is good to know that even though 24 was cancelled, it will be returning.  I look forward to the returning exploits of Jack Bauer.

Everything about this purchase was excellent... Fast shipping & got exactly what I wanted... Only negative would be on disc 5 the 3 episode skipped very bad to the point I had to skip to the next scene selection, but even with that I was thoroughly satisfied...
I love the split screen set up and the cast is top notch, Keifer Sutherland fans should love this series

I don't know why, but I never watched 24 when it aired.  My wife and I started watching it more than 10 years after it first aired.  We're hooked.  We like it a lot.  Season 2 moves along at a fast pace and every episode does a great job of resolving the prior episode's cliffhanger ending and building to its own.  One storyline in the show - the one involving Jack's daughter Kim - has turned out not so great.  Talk about someone with bad luck and poor judgment!  On top of that, almost everyone she meets has an evil streak.  Having said that, even those segments with her are still fun to watch.
All in all a great show to sit down with and do some serious binge watching!  You'll find you can't help yourself.
I am enjoying the show very much. Nicely done, great story with lots of detail. I watch two shows a night before bed with no commercials.
Every episode keeps me hooked. I sit down to watch one episode and end up watching 3 or 4 so if you have limited time, beware.
Exciting & thrilling! Love it from the start! Rapid pace from the word "go"! :) Can't wait to watch next Season!
Love the real-time , forgot how good these were, great to re watch the series with new ones coming up this year!
Drama and suspense. Sometimes a little unbelievable, but overall content "clean" if you don't mind some violence. It is nice to be able to watch the episodes back to back.
great suspense from beginning to end of every single episode. Had to binge watch it. Couldn't stop after just one or 2 episodes
Nice screenplay. But Storyline is same in all seasons. Need good work on cameraman. Too much shaky in action scenes.
What happened? Season One was intriguing and suspenseful, but Season Two-whoa; it's full of torture scenes and has no cohesive plot. No thanks.

What can I say, Jack Bauer does it again in Season 2, providing a gripping drama full of all the action my heart can take.  A nuclear bomb on US soil provides the basis for the plot twists of this season.  We had to watch the full season in just a few days as the suspense builds episode by episode until the climactic finale.  It is violent, to be sure, but that's necessary in the world of CTU and the "hostiles". Watch it -- you will not be disappointed.

I did not think it was possible to come close to the intelligent writing of season 1, but the writers did it again.  The second season did a great job of bringing just enough of Season 1 into the scene.  Great series!

I love EVERY season of "24!"  Jack Bauer is so awesome.  Chloe is another of my favorite characters.  My family and I have watched many episodes together. Season one was the introduction to the characters, etc.  This series gets better as it goes along!
We got this for a gift and it's a great series.  They love 24... so they loved this gift too!

This kept me on the edge of my seat! Wow. Jack Bauer is the toughest guy ever, and he has the worst job ever. Poor guy! If there really are people doing this kind of counter-terrorism work, we all owe them a huge debt of gratitude!

if you want a show with action jack is going to make sure you will get just that.
jack is a bad boy.........
A show filled with totally impossible scenarios and feats that could be achieved by no human being ever.  The best!  I love it!
Very intense, very explosive, but amazing to watch. If you're a big 24 watcher, you'll be on the edge of your seat watching this. Highly recommend this season.

I've been going back and re-watching the older seasons to get ready for Jack's epic comeback in 2014. Season 1 is still my favorite, but season 2 had a much darker tone and was very fast paced. The element of torture was introduced. A year after Jack saves David Palmer and loses his wife, he's retired from CTU. A threat of a nuclear bomb brings Jack out of retirement and forced to help CTU and President Palmer find the bomb before it explodes in Los Angeles. Throughout the course of the day, Kim must deal with her abusive boss, George Mason becomes infected by radiation, Jack comes face-to-face with Nina Myers, and much more! I highly recommend 24: DAY 2!!!
LOVED THIS SERIES!!  FIRST VIDEO I WATCHED ON MY KNIDLE, AND IT WORKED PRETTY WELL!!  WILL WATCH ALL OF THEM IF POSSIBLE!

I am missing this show real bad since it ended, I watch it over and over, kinda like I watch
Silence of the Lambs over and over , also Godfather , great shows all of them.
Action packed with many twists and turns, It will keep you guessing, Great cast,  however the last couple of segments started to drag on.
It is a great show. We had never seen it so I got the seasons and we are watching it now. We are on season 5.

When 24 aired, I did not watch it. I was lost in the show Lost. Boy, did I make a mistake. 24 is the most action packed, thrilling show I have ever watched. My husband and I are enjoying all the seasons on Prime. When we watch an episode, we can't stop...we have to watch just one more. What an addiction! LOVE IT!!!

The subplot involving the daughter seems (at least though first third of series) completely gratuitous, having nothing to do with the main issues and a complete coincidence to give the character, established in the first series, a problem to deal with. Considering the gravity of the main plot, everyone's actions seem too motivated by personal history than a sense of perspectice.
love the show when it was originally on...loved it even more the second time around...still sitting on the edge of my chair
...b/c only Jack can do it! Have become a huge fan!  Thanks Amazon for making this possible thru Prime membership!

Great serious!!!
The writing for this show is amazing good. So many topics and events are presented that  actually happened in our country years after these things were presented in 24.
Exciting at first...until you realize it just keeps going and going...the unexpected becomes the expected and then it gets boring.  Devoured Season 1 and I'm out after Season 2.

This season was disappointing.  I thought the plot too closely paralleled season one and Kim's character was so annoying, by the end of the season I was rooting for her to get killed.  I took several months off before watching season three.
Could not stop watching the episodes.  Watched til 3 AM most days and though the weekend.  Glad there are 8 seasons.
We didn't get to see 24 while it was on  air. So after a while ( 10 years or so), we started to watch it. Can't seem to stop until the whole 24 episodes are played through. A Marathon. Great!

'24 was a hit TV Series that I impatiently waited for episode to episode, season to season. It was high drama and action.  I was excited when it became available through Amazon's Prime Video Streaming and Netflix.  If you are eligible, go get it and watch

After re-watching the 24 series I am wondering why I was so in inthalled by it when it was on TV.  Now I see really how corny and bad some of the acting was..  Probably should have left my memories alone.
This was another great season.  Couldn't stop watching the series till it was done.  Highly recommend to any enjoying a great show.

Well written , suspenseful but somewhat violent.  Torture sceans  difficult to watch but overall, one of the best drama series I have seen.  The character, Kim, is either one of the most unlucky teens ever or she just doesn't have good sense, can't decide which.  Will probably go for season 3 to see what happens next.
I did not watch the original broadcast of the series but thoroughly enjoy the streaming of the 24 hours. Watch when you can or do a marathon viewings.
Best tv show ever<3 wanted watch it over and over jack is the best james bond aint nothing jack rules

I didn't like this series when it first came out but now I think its one of the most compelling exciting series out there. I bought all 8 series and I hear he might restart  24 again. BRAVO Kiefer Sutherland.

This is one of the best suspense shows I have ever seen...the ability to create one tragedy after another is very unique and always keeping the viewer entertained week after week... This show definitely took tv sispense action shows to a new level unseen before on regular television...the actors were excellent & Jack was phoenomenal......5Stars!!!!!

A brilliant 24 season, not the best but still great and I am only writing this review as i have seen a few reviews that mention kim, yes its annoying that shes just interrupting the day and being a total blonde from horror movies, BUT for me this just adds to the pressure on jack as he can not afford to lose someone else and with everything going on in his day its good to have what's happening to him, it creates more tension and makes the season more interesting, yes when it was happening I wanted to shoot kim, luckily on season 7 you will think differently as shes matured and isn't as dumb, but all in all I love 24 and every season has been fantastic!
This show was so excellent.  It's been fun re-watching some of the old show.  Can't wait to see the show come back!

Really?  This poor man. After all he's done for the unknowing American citizens, is he still not fully trusted?  Excitement rules the day, but once again, his poor daughter has just as exciting, traumatic day as she did a few months ago.  Why does she never communicate the real story...ever?  Teenagers!!

Season 2, or Day 2, involves a plot from a syndicate to pump up oil prices by starting a war between the U.S. and unnamed Middle East countries by helping to explode a nuclear bomb on U.S. soil, then fabricating a recording implicating those foreign countries.  Bauer not only volunteers to give his life by personally flying the bomb into the desert and allowing it to explode safely, but survives only to be tortured then confront the syndicate leader, all the while being opposed by pencil necked blue suits from "district".  Kim Bauer's cheesy encounter with the cougar aside, this season was filled with the themes frightening many Americans after the 9/11 attack.  Great television that's hard to not watch several times.
